content.text:
# 1907 college football rankings

The 1907 college football season rankings included a ranking by Caspar Whitney for The Outing Magazine.
Caspar Whitney
Writing for The Outing Magazine, alongside his All-America Eleven for 1907, Caspar Whitney ranked the top fourteen teams in the country at the conclusion of the season.
Whitney is designated by the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) as a "major selector" of national championships, and his contemporary rankings in Outing for 1905–1907 are included in the NCAA college football records book.
